isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992-1993 - DIAGNOSTICS

svcsubsecinfo.para: All PEEC and 3176 equipped vehicles have a yellow "Engine Warning" light located in the instrument cluster. This light communicates engine status.

During normal vehicle startup, turning the key to the ON position causes the Engine Warning light to come on as a system test. It remains on for about 6 seconds, then goes off. If the Engine Warning light stays on after the initial startup, the ECM has detected a problem with the engine.
If during vehicle operation, the Engine Warning light comes on, it indicates that an active fault is present. The light will remain on, but blink approximately every 5 seconds for a brief 1/2 second.
